segment.source: Release Notes for App-V 5.1
segment.target: Release Notes for App-V 5.1

segment.source: Release Notes for App-V 5.1
segment.target: Release Notes for App-V 5.1

segment.source: Release Notes for App-V 5.1
segment.target: Release Notes for App-V 5.1

segment.source: The following are known issues in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1.
segment.target: The following are known issues in Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1.

segment.source: Error occurs during publishing refresh between App-V 5.0 SP3 Management Server and App-V 5.1 Client on Windows 10
segment.target: Error occurs during publishing refresh between App-V 5.0 SP3 Management Server and App-V 5.1 Client on Windows 10

segment.source: An error is generated during publishing refresh when synchronizing packages from the App-V 5.0 SP3 management server to an App-V 5.1 client on Windows 10 .
segment.target: An error is generated during publishing refresh when synchronizing packages from the App-V 5.0 SP3 management server to an App-V 5.1 client on Windows 10 .

segment.source: This error occurs because the App-V 5.0 SP3 server does not understand the Windows 10 operating system that is specified in the publishing URL.
segment.target: This error occurs because the App-V 5.0 SP3 server does not understand the Windows 10 operating system that is specified in the publishing URL.

segment.source: The issue is fixed for App-V 5.1 publishing server, but is not backported to versions of App-V 5.0 SP3 or earlier.
segment.target: The issue is fixed for App-V 5.1 publishing server, but is not backported to versions of App-V 5.0 SP3 or earlier.

segment.source: Workaround: Upgrade the App-V 5.0 Management server to the App-V 5.1 Management server for Windows 10 Clients.
segment.target: Workaround: Upgrade the App-V 5.0 Management server to the App-V 5.1 Management server for Windows 10 Clients.

segment.source: Custom configurations do not get applied for packages that will be published globally if they are set using the App-V 5.1 Server
segment.target: Custom configurations do not get applied for packages that will be published globally if they are set using the App-V 5.1 Server

segment.source: If you assign a package to an AD group that contains machine accounts and apply a custom configuration to that group using the App-V Server, the custom configuration will not be applied to those machines.
segment.target: If you assign a package to an AD group that contains machine accounts and apply a custom configuration to that group using the App-V Server, the custom configuration will not be applied to those machines.

segment.source: The App-V 5.1 Client will publish packages assigned to a machine account globally.
segment.target: The App-V 5.1 Client will publish packages assigned to a machine account globally.

segment.source: However, it stores custom configuration files per user in each user’s profile.
segment.target: However, it stores custom configuration files per user in each user’s profile.

segment.source: Globally published packages will not have access to this custom configuration.
segment.target: Globally published packages will not have access to this custom configuration.

segment.source: Workaround: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Workaround: Do one of the following:

segment.source: Assign the package to groups containing only user accounts.
segment.target: Assign the package to groups containing only user accounts.

segment.source: This will ensure that the package’s custom configuration will be stored in each user’s profile and will be applied correctly.
segment.target: This will ensure that the package’s custom configuration will be stored in each user’s profile and will be applied correctly.

segment.source: Create a custom deployment configuration file and apply it to the package on the client using the Add-AppvClientPackage cmdlet with the –DynamicDeploymentConfiguration parameter.
segment.target: Create a custom deployment configuration file and apply it to the package on the client using the Add-AppvClientPackage cmdlet with the –DynamicDeploymentConfiguration parameter.

segment.source: See About App-V 5.1 Dynamic Configuration for more information.
segment.target: See About App-V 5.1 Dynamic Configuration for more information.

segment.source: Create a new package with the custom configuration using the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.
segment.target: Create a new package with the custom configuration using the App-V 5.1 Sequencer.

segment.source: Server files not deleted after new App-V 5.1 Server installation
segment.target: Server files not deleted after new App-V 5.1 Server installation

segment.source: If you uninstall the App-V 5.0 SP1 Server and then install the App-V 5.1 Server, the installation fails, the wrong version of the Management server is installed, and an error message is returned.
segment.target: If you uninstall the App-V 5.0 SP1 Server and then install the App-V 5.1 Server, the installation fails, the wrong version of the Management server is installed, and an error message is returned.

segment.source: The issue occurs because the Server files are not being deleted when you uninstall App-V 5.0 SP1, so the installation process does an upgrade instead of a new installation.
segment.target: The issue occurs because the Server files are not being deleted when you uninstall App-V 5.0 SP1, so the installation process does an upgrade instead of a new installation.

segment.source: Workaround: Delete this registry key before you start installing App-V 5.1:
segment.target: Workaround: Delete this registry key before you start installing App-V 5.1:

segment.source: Under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionUninstall, locate and delete the installation GUID key that contains the DWORD value "DisplayName" with value data "Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Server".
segment.target: Under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftWindowsCurrentVersionUninstall, locate and delete the installation GUID key that contains the DWORD value "DisplayName" with value data "Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Server".

segment.source: This is the only key that should be deleted.
segment.target: This is the only key that should be deleted.

segment.source: File type associations added manually are not saved correctly
segment.target: File type associations added manually are not saved correctly

segment.source: File type associations added to an application package manually using the Shortcuts and FTAs tab at the end of the application upgrade wizard are not saved correctly.
segment.target: File type associations added to an application package manually using the Shortcuts and FTAs tab at the end of the application upgrade wizard are not saved correctly.

segment.source: They will not be available to the App-V Client or to the Sequencer when updating the saved package again.
segment.target: They will not be available to the App-V Client or to the Sequencer when updating the saved package again.

segment.source: Workaround: To add a file type association, open the package for modification and run the update wizard.
segment.target: Workaround: To add a file type association, open the package for modification and run the update wizard.

segment.source: During the Installation step, add the new file type association through the operating system.
segment.target: During the Installation step, add the new file type association through the operating system.

segment.source: The sequencer will detect the new association in the system registry and add it to the package’s virtual registry, where it will be available to the client.
segment.target: The sequencer will detect the new association in the system registry and add it to the package’s virtual registry, where it will be available to the client.

segment.source: When streaming packages in Shared Content Store (SCS) mode to a client that is also managed with AppLocker, additional data is written to the local disk.
segment.target: When streaming packages in Shared Content Store (SCS) mode to a client that is also managed with AppLocker, additional data is written to the local disk.

segment.source: To decrease the amount of data written to a client’s local disk, you can enable SCS mode on the App-V 5.1 Client to stream the contents of a package on demand.
segment.target: To decrease the amount of data written to a client’s local disk, you can enable SCS mode on the App-V 5.1 Client to stream the contents of a package on demand.

segment.source: However, if AppLocker manages an application within the package, some data might be written to the client’s local disk that would not otherwise be written.
segment.target: However, if AppLocker manages an application within the package, some data might be written to the client’s local disk that would not otherwise be written.

segment.source: Workaround: None
segment.target: Workaround: None

segment.source: In the Management Console Add Package dialog box, the Browse button is not available when using Chrome or Firefox
segment.target: In the Management Console Add Package dialog box, the Browse button is not available when using Chrome or Firefox

segment.source: On the Packages page of the Management Console, if you click Add or Upgrade in the lower-right corner, the Add Package dialog box appears.
segment.target: On the Packages page of the Management Console, if you click Add or Upgrade in the lower-right corner, the Add Package dialog box appears.

segment.source: If you are accessing the Management Console using Chrome or Firefox as your browser, you will not be able to browse to the location of the package.
segment.target: If you are accessing the Management Console using Chrome or Firefox as your browser, you will not be able to browse to the location of the package.

segment.source: Workaround: Type or copy and paste the path to the package into the Add Package input field.
segment.target: Workaround: Type or copy and paste the path to the package into the Add Package input field.

segment.source: If the Management Console has access to this path, you will be able to add the package.
segment.target: If the Management Console has access to this path, you will be able to add the package.

segment.source: If the package is on a network share, you can browse to the location using File Explorer by doing these steps:
segment.target: If the package is on a network share, you can browse to the location using File Explorer by doing these steps:

segment.source: While pressing Shift, right-click on the package file
segment.target: While pressing Shift, right-click on the package file

segment.source: Select Copy as path
segment.target: Select Copy as path

segment.source: Paste the path into the Add Package dialog box input field
segment.target: Paste the path into the Add Package dialog box input field

segment.source: Upgrading App-V Management Server to 5.1 sometimes fails with the message “A database error occurred”
segment.target: Upgrading App-V Management Server to 5.1 sometimes fails with the message “A database error occurred”

segment.source: If you install the App-V 5.0 SP1 Management Server, and then try to upgrade to App-V 5.1 Server when multiple connection groups are configured and enabled, the following error is displayed: “A database error occurred.
segment.target: If you install the App-V 5.0 SP1 Management Server, and then try to upgrade to App-V 5.1 Server when multiple connection groups are configured and enabled, the following error is displayed: “A database error occurred.

segment.source: Reason: 'Invalid column name 'PackageOptional'.
segment.target: Reason: 'Invalid column name 'PackageOptional'.

segment.source: Invalid column name 'VersionOptional'.”
segment.target: Invalid column name 'VersionOptional'.”

segment.source: Workaround: Run this command on your SQL database:
segment.target: Workaround: Run this command on your SQL database:

segment.source: where “AppVManagement” is the name of the database.
segment.target: where “AppVManagement” is the name of the database.

segment.source: Users cannot open a package in a user-published connection group if you add or remove an optional package
segment.target: Users cannot open a package in a user-published connection group if you add or remove an optional package

segment.source: In environments that are running the RDS Client or that have multiple concurrent users per computer, logged-in users cannot open applications in packages that are in a user-published connection group if an optional package is added to or removed from the connection group.
segment.target: In environments that are running the RDS Client or that have multiple concurrent users per computer, logged-in users cannot open applications in packages that are in a user-published connection group if an optional package is added to or removed from the connection group.

segment.source: Workaround: Have users log out and then log back in.
segment.target: Workaround: Have users log out and then log back in.

segment.source: Error message is erroneously displayed when the connection group is published only to the user
segment.target: Error message is erroneously displayed when the connection group is published only to the user

segment.source: When you run Repair-AppvClientConnectionGroup, the following error is displayed, even when the connection group is published only to the user: “Internal App-V Integration error: Package not integrated for the user.
segment.target: When you run Repair-AppvClientConnectionGroup, the following error is displayed, even when the connection group is published only to the user: “Internal App-V Integration error: Package not integrated for the user.

segment.source: Please ensure that the package is added to the machine and published to the user.”
segment.target: Please ensure that the package is added to the machine and published to the user.”

segment.source: Workaround: Do one of the following:
segment.target: Workaround: Do one of the following:

segment.source: Publish all packages in a connection group.
segment.target: Publish all packages in a connection group.

segment.source: The problem arises when the connection group being repaired has packages that are missing or not available to the user (that is, not published globally or to the user).
segment.target: The problem arises when the connection group being repaired has packages that are missing or not available to the user (that is, not published globally or to the user).

segment.source: However, the repair will work if all of the connection group’s packages are available, so ensure that all packages are published.
segment.target: However, the repair will work if all of the connection group’s packages are available, so ensure that all packages are published.

segment.source: Repair packages individually using the Repair-AppvClientPackage command rather than the Repair-AppvClientConnectionGroup command.
segment.target: Repair packages individually using the Repair-AppvClientPackage command rather than the Repair-AppvClientConnectionGroup command.

segment.source: Determine which packages are available to users and then run the Repair-AppvClientPackage command once for each package.
segment.target: Determine which packages are available to users and then run the Repair-AppvClientPackage command once for each package.

segment.source: Use PowerShell cmdlets to do the following:
segment.target: Use PowerShell cmdlets to do the following:

segment.source: Get all the packages in a connection group.
segment.target: Get all the packages in a connection group.

segment.source: Check to see if each package is currently published.
segment.target: Check to see if each package is currently published.

segment.source: If the package is currently published, run Repair-AppvClientPackage on that package.
segment.target: If the package is currently published, run Repair-AppvClientPackage on that package.

segment.source: Icons not displayed properly in Sequencer
segment.target: Icons not displayed properly in Sequencer

segment.source: Icons in the Shortcuts and File Type Associations tab are not displayed correctly when modifying a package in the App-V Sequencer.
segment.target: Icons in the Shortcuts and File Type Associations tab are not displayed correctly when modifying a package in the App-V Sequencer.

segment.source: This problem occurs when the size of the icons are not 16x16 or 32x32.
segment.target: This problem occurs when the size of the icons are not 16x16 or 32x32.

segment.source: Workaround: Only use icons that are 16x16 or 32x32.
segment.target: Workaround: Only use icons that are 16x16 or 32x32.

segment.source: InsertVersionInfo.sql script no longer required for the Management Database
segment.target: InsertVersionInfo.sql script no longer required for the Management Database

segment.source: The InsertVersionInfo.sql script is not required for versions of the App-V management database later than App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: The InsertVersionInfo.sql script is not required for versions of the App-V management database later than App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: The Permissions.sql script should be updated according to Step 2 in KB article 3031340.
segment.target: The Permissions.sql script should be updated according to Step 2 in KB article 3031340.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Step 1 is not required for versions of App-V later than App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: Step 1 is not required for versions of App-V later than App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 not supported
segment.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 not supported

segment.source: App-V 5.1 does not support Visual Studio 2012.
segment.target: App-V 5.1 does not support Visual Studio 2012.

segment.source: Workaround: None
segment.target: Workaround: None

segment.source: Application filename restrictions for App-V 5.x Sequencer
segment.target: Application filename restrictions for App-V 5.x Sequencer

segment.source: The App-V 5.x Sequencer cannot sequence applications with filenames matching "CO_x" where x is any numeral.
segment.target: The App-V 5.x Sequencer cannot sequence applications with filenames matching "CO_x" where x is any numeral.

segment.source: Error 0x8007139F will be generated.
segment.target: Error 0x8007139F will be generated.

segment.source: Workaround: Use a different filename
segment.target: Workaround: Use a different filename

segment.source: Got a suggestion for App-V?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
